entry.codeblock: Is this region a continuation of another region (in previous column or page, for example)?
For generic use

<complexType name="RegionType" abstract="true"> <sequence> <element name="Coords" type="pc:CoordsType"/> <element name="UserDefined" type="pc:UserDefinedType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"> </element> <element name="Roles" type="pc:RolesType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"> <annotation> <documentation>Roles the region takes (e.g. in context of a parent region)</documentation> </annotation> </element> <choice minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <element name="TextRegion" type="pc:TextRegionType"/> <element name="ImageRegion" type="pc:ImageRegionType"/> <element name="LineDrawingRegion" type="pc:LineDrawingRegionType"> </element> <element name="GraphicRegion" type="pc:GraphicRegionType"> </element> <element name="TableRegion" type="pc:TableRegionType"/> <element name="ChartRegion" type="pc:ChartRegionType"/> <element name="SeparatorRegion" type="pc:SeparatorRegionType"> </element> <element name="MathsRegion" type="pc:MathsRegionType"/> <element name="ChemRegion" type="pc:ChemRegionType"/> <element name="MusicRegion" type="pc:MusicRegionType"/> <element name="AdvertRegion" type="pc:AdvertRegionType"> </element> <element name="NoiseRegion" type="pc:NoiseRegionType"/> <element name="UnknownRegion" type="pc:UnknownRegionType"> </element> </choice> </sequence> <attribute name="id" type="ID" use="required"/> <attribute name="custom" type="string"> <annotation> <documentation>For generic use</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> <attribute name="comments" type="string"/> <attribute name="continuation" type="boolean"> <annotation> <documentation>Is this region a continuation of another region (in previous column or page, for example)?</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> </complexType>
<attribute name="id" type="ID" use="required"/>
For generic use
<attribute name="custom" type="string"> <annotation> <documentation>For generic use</documentation> </annotation> </attribute>
<attribute name="comments" type="string"/>
Is this region a continuation of another region (in previous column or page, for example)?

<attribute name="continuation" type="boolean"> <annotation> <documentation>Is this region a continuation of another region (in previous column or page, for example)?</documentation> </annotation> </attribute>
Point list with format "x1,y1 x2,y2 ..."
<element name="Coords" type="pc:CoordsType"/>

<pc:UserDefined xmlns:pc="http://schema.primaresearch.org/PAGE/gts/pagecontent/2017-07-15"> <pc:UserAttribute description="" name="" type="" value="">{1,unbounded}</pc:UserAttribute> </pc:UserDefined>
<element name="UserDefined" type="pc:UserDefinedType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"> </element>
Roles the region takes (e.g. in context of a parent region)
<pc:Roles xmlns:pc="http://schema.primaresearch.org/PAGE/gts/pagecontent/2017-07-15"> <pc:TableCellRole colSpan="" columnIndex="" rowIndex="" rowSpan="">{0,1}</pc:TableCellRole> </pc:Roles>
<element name="Roles" type="pc:RolesType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"> <annotation> <documentation>Roles the region takes (e.g. in context of a parent region)</documentation> </annotation> </element>

comments="" continuation="" custom="" id="">{1,1}</pc:UnknownRegion> <pc:TextLine comments="" custom="" id="" primaryLanguage="" primaryScript="" production="" readingDirection="" secondaryScript="">{0,unbounded}</pc:TextLine> <pc:TextEquiv comments="" conf="" dataType="" dataTypeDetails="" index="">{0,unbounded}</pc:TextEquiv> <pc:TextStyle bgColour="" bgColourRgb="" bold="" fontFamily="" fontSize="" italic="" kerning="" letterSpaced="" monospace="" reverseVideo="" serif="" smallCaps="" strikethrough="" subscript="" superscript="" textColour="" textColourRgb="" underlined="" xHeight="">{0,1}</pc:TextStyle> </pc:TextRegion>
Text align
Is this region a continuation of another region (in previous column or page, for example)?
For generic use
Defines whether a region of text is indented or not
The degree of space in points between the lines of text (line spacing)
The angle the rectangle encapsulating a region has to be rotated in clockwise direction in order to correct the present skew (negative values indicate anti-clockwise rotation). Range: -179.999,180
The primary language used in the region
The primary script used in the region
The direction in which text in a region should be read (within lines)

The angle the baseline of text withing a region has to be rotated (relative to the rectangle encapsulating the region) in clockwise direction in order to correct the present skew (negative values indicate anti-clockwise rotation). Range: -179.999,180
The secondary language used in the region
The secondary script used in the region
Inner-block order of text lines (in addition to “readingDirection” which is the inner-text line order of words and characters)
The nature of the text in the region
<element name="TextRegion" type="pc:TextRegionType"/>

The colour bit depth required for the region
Is this region a continuation of another region (in previous column or page, for example)?
For generic use
Specifies whether the region also contains text
The angle the rectangle encapsulating a region has to be rotated in clockwise direction in order to correct the present skew (negative values indicate anti-clockwise rotation). Range: -179.999,180

Is this region a continuation of another region (in previous column or page, for example)?
For generic use
Specifies whether the region also contains text.
An approximation of the number of colours used in the region
The angle the rectangle encapsulating a region has to be rotated in clockwise direction in order to correct the present skew (negative values indicate anti-clockwise rotation). Range: -179.999,180
The type of graphic in the region
<element name="GraphicRegion" type="pc:GraphicRegionType"> </element>

The background colour of the region
The number of columns present in the table
Is this region a continuation of another region (in previous column or page, for example)?
For generic use
Specifies whether the region also contains text
The colour of the lines used in the region
Specifies the presence of line separators
The angle the rectangle encapsulating a region has to be rotated in clockwise direction in order to correct the present skew (negative values indicate anti-clockwise rotation). Range: -179.999,180
The number of rows present in the table
<element name="TableRegion" type="pc:TableRegionType"/>

The background colour of the region
Is this region a continuation of another region (in previous column or page, for example)?
For generic use
The angle the rectangle encapsulating a region has to be rotated in clockwise direction in order to correct the present skew (negative values indicate anti-clockwise rotation). Range: -179.999,180
